topic: Triage a support queue: classify 6 tickets by severity and assign owners

claims: Ticket #101 (data loss report) is P0 — customer cannot access saved work.
Ticket #102 (UI alignment issue) is P3 — cosmetic, no functional impact.
Ticket #103 (slow dashboard load) is P2 — performance degradation affecting multiple users.
Ticket #104 (typo in error message) is P3 — cosmetic.
Ticket #105 (login fails on Safari) is P1 — blocking a segment of users.
Ticket #106 (feature request: dark mode) is P4 — enhancement, not a bug.
open_questions: Is #103 related to the database migration from last week?
How many users are affected by #105 (Safari login)?
outputs.summary: Initial triage: 1 P0, 1 P1, 1 P2, 2 P3, 1 P4. Two questions need data before final assignment.

claims: Ticket #101 (data loss report) is P0 — customer cannot access saved work.
Ticket #103 (slow dashboard load) is P2 — performance degradation affecting multiple users.
Ticket #105 (login fails on Safari) is P1 — blocking a segment of users.
#103 correlates with the database migration — the new index is not covering a key query.
Safari represents 12% of active users, confirming #105 as P1.
decisions: Assign #103 to the database team (migration follow-up).
Assign #105 to the frontend team (browser compat).
Assign #102 and #104 to the next sprint backlog.
next_actions: Update ticket statuses in the tracker.
outputs.summary: All tickets classified and assigned. Open questions resolved with data. Queue is clear.

claims: Ticket #101 (data loss report) is P0 — customer cannot access saved work.
#103 correlates with the database migration — the new index is not covering a key query.
Safari represents 12% of active users, confirming #105 as P1.
outputs.summary: Restating completed triage. No reclassifications. Execute notifications.

diminishing_returns_note.rationale: Round 2 resolves all open questions and completes assignments. Round 3 is restatement.

_expected.reason: All tickets classified, all assignments made, zero open questions. Fast convergence due to data-driven resolution.
